Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) The study is a commercial service offered to patients with brain cancer.
B) The study is a routine treatment that all patients with brain cancer receive.
C) The study is a research project investigating the effectiveness of the CALM therapy approach for brain cancer patients.
D) The study is a mandatory government program for brain cancer surveillance.

Correct answer: C) The study is a research project investigating the effectiveness of the CALM therapy approach for brain cancer patients.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) To compare the effectiveness of different chemotherapy drugs for brain cancer; B) To assess the impact of the CALM therapy on mood and quality of life in brain cancer patients; C) To determine the best surgical techniques for treating brain metastasis; D) To evaluate the financial costs of long-term cancer treatment

Correct answer: B

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the total expected duration of participation for subjects in the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) 3 months; B) 4 months; C) 6 months; D) 12 months

Correct answer: C) 6 months

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
What financial costs will you, as a participant, be responsible for if you decide to join the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) You will be responsible for the costs of the CALM intervention sessions.
B) You will need to pay for the online surveys and Zoom sessions.
C) There are no financial costs to you for participating in this study.
D) You will be charged for the therapy materials provided during the study.

Correct answer: C) There are no financial costs to you for participating in this study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What is the correct sequence of procedures a participant will undergo after enrolling in the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?

A) Complete online surveys, attend CALM intervention sessions, participate in an exit interview, and receive Amazon e-gift cards as compensation.
B) Attend CALM intervention sessions, complete online surveys, receive Amazon e-gift cards as compensation, and participate in an exit interview.
C) Participate in an exit interview, complete online surveys, attend CALM intervention sessions, and receive Amazon e-gift cards as compensation.
D) Receive Amazon e-gift cards as compensation, complete online surveys, participate in an exit interview, and attend CALM intervention sessions.

Correct answer: A) Complete online surveys, attend CALM intervention sessions, participate in an exit interview, and receive Amazon e-gift cards as compensation.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) You will be required to pay for any services you received during the study; B) Withdrawing from the study will result in a loss of medical care benefits; C) You will no longer be eligible to receive the $20 Amazon e-gift card for participation; D) Your decision to withdraw will not affect your medical care or entitlement to benefits you otherwise have.

Correct answer: D

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) 50 participants; B) 100 participants; C) 150 participants; D) The document does not specify the number of participants. 

Correct answer: D) The document does not specify the number of participants.

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What are the potential risks or discomforts that participants might experience in the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) Physical side effects from medication; B) Emotional distress from discussing personal health issues; C) Financial costs for participating in the study; D) Risk of cancer progression due to participation

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
What potential benefits may participants experience from the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) Guaranteed cure for brain cancer
B) Improvement in mood and quality of life
C) Financial gain from the sale of personal health information
D) Access to exclusive medical treatments not available to non-participants

Correct answer: B

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your personal health information will be protected during the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?
A) Your personal health information will be shared publicly to promote the study.
B) Your personal health information will be kept private and stored securely, with access limited to authorized individuals.
C) Your personal health information will be disclosed to all study sponsors without any restrictions.
D) Your personal health information will be used for marketing purposes unrelated to the study.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience any injury as a direct result of participating in the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study, which of the following statements is true regarding compensation and medical treatment?
A) You will receive free medical treatment for the injury and compensation for participating in the study.
B) You will receive compensation for participating in the study, but the consent form does not mention free medical treatment for injuries.
C) The study will provide both compensation and medical treatment for any injuries sustained during the study.
D) The consent form does not specify any compensation or medical treatment for injuries related to the study.

Correct answer: D

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What will happen if you choose not to participate or decide to withdraw from the Managing Distress in Malignant Brain Cancer study?

A) You will lose access to certain medical treatments that are only available to study participants.
B) You may face penalties or a loss of medical benefits you currently have.
C) Your current medical care, employment status, or academic standing will not be affected, and you will retain all your benefits.
D) You will be required to pay a fee for withdrawing from the study.

Correct answer: C) Your current medical care, employment status, or academic standing will not be affected, and you will retain all your benefits.
